dismissalText.commentary: Avishka Fernando c Allen b Cottrell 104 (103b 9x4 2x6 151m) SR: 100.97

dismissalComment.html: slower ball, and that brings the innings to an end! Cottrell salutes him off, and for once, it looks like a compliment rather than a send-off. Struck way too low on the bat and ballooned to long-off instead of getting distance on it. 104 off 103. It's au revoir, Avishka, definitely not adieu

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera run out (Cottrell/Brathwaite) 64 (51b 8x4 0x6 87m) SR: 125.49

dismissalComment.html: a wicket thrown away! Back of a length on leg, and tapped to midwicket. Perera wants the double, but his partner hasn't responded, and the throw from deep midwicket is well aimed at the bowler's end. To be fair to Fernando, there was no two there

headshotImage.caption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: tickle! Length ball, angling away from Dimuth, and he throws his hands at a square-cut. Ball jags away very late, takes the bat's toe-end and deposits itself in the keeper's gloves. A useful 32 comes to an end, and time for drinks as well

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: Hashir, what have you done?! Yorker on middle, and Mathews is caught in no-mans-land since he's coming down the wicket. The ball beats him even before he can get his bat down. Another wicket for Holder

dismissalComment.html: nomination for catch of the tournament? Low full toss on leg stump, and Mendis looks to drive straight. Ball pops up while trying to play the shot, and Allen dives to his right to take a remarkable flying catch. Proper hangtime!

dismissalText.commentary: Nicholas Pooran c Perera b Mathews 118 (103b 11x4 4x6 156m) SR: 114.56

dismissalComment.html: Mathews strikes first ball! And what a fistpump to celebrate, very nearly knocked his team-mate out with that fist. Full ball outside off stump, angling away, and Pooran's attempted slog past cover takes a thin edge of his bat. Rousing applause for Pooran though

dismissalText.commentary: Fabian Allen run out (Rajitha/Udana) 51 (32b 7x4 1x6 50m) SR: 159.37

dismissalComment.html: third run-out of the innings! Atleast it's not Pooran, who is currently on 99. This was flicked to short fine leg, and Pooran had ran across despite Allen not moving. Allen was ball-watching, and when he saw Pooran reach the other end, he scampered across to ensure that Pooran isn't run-out. Allen sacrifices his wicket, but did West Indies need to throw a wicket away at this stage? Probably not...

dismissalComment.html: appeal for caught-behind and he raises his finger! Short, on off and getting big on Ambris. He shapes to pull, but takes a feathered top-edge that the keeper holds on to. Fistpump from Mali!

headshotImage.caption: Shai Hope player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shai Hope player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: the over's extra ball gets a wicket! That's rare. These balls usually get punished for four. But Hope is deceived by another slower ball, and the back-foot punch is inside-edged onto his stumps

headshotImage.caption: Oshane Thomas player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Oshane Thomas player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: appeal for lbw but not given. Full, on leg stump, and the ball did hit his pad. Malinga reviews. Was there inside edge? Or did it land outside leg stump. Only one of those two things can save Oshane. Replays show that it lands on leg stump, takes no edge of the bat, and hits him on leg stump. What does ball tracking say? Crashing into leg stump! Umpire Oxenford has to reverse his decision...

dismissalText.commentary: Shimron Hetmyer run out (de Silva) 29 (38b 2x4 0x6 62m) SR: 76.31

dismissalComment.html: what on earth was that? Direct hit, gone! Hetmyer dismissed Tickled it to short third and set off on a run without ever lifting his head up to see if his partner was following through. When he did he was more than halfway down, and a direct hit meant he wasn't even in the frame. West Indies are rocking now

dismissalComment.html: and that's out, I believe! What a way for Brathwaite to go! Pooran drove it down the ground, and Udana looks like he got a finger to it, before the ball hit the stumps. Brathwaite was well out of his ground. They have gone upstairs
Brathwaite is gone, the ball kissed Udana's long middle finger before thudding into the stumps. Unfortunate for the Windies

commentTextItems.html: length ball outside off, and flat-batted to cover. Sri Lanka win by 23 runs!

commentPostTextItems.html: 7.20pm That's all from us at ESPNcricinfo. See you tomorrow for a big clash - India v Bangladesh. Till then, on behalf of our scoring team and Danyal, this is Sreshth signing off

Jason Holder: "We have just got to be better. We've let some key moments slip in this World Cup. I thought their score was on par. Fernando batted well - showed us things get easier if you stay in. Pooran was excellent too. I thought we finished our bowling well. But our fielding let us down. That run-out was crucial, Hetmyer's run-out was crucial too. We just want to play the perfect game next time."

Dimuth Karunaratne: "Really good - got confidence. All the boys contributed. Those are the things I expect as captain. We put additional pressure on ourselves earlier. We all know Sri Lanka play freely, the way you saw Avishka. If you take our middle order, they were more positives. We want to play freely in our next games too. On Angelo Mathews bowling, Vandersay was leaking some runs, so offered Mathews couple of overs."

7.13pm For those asking, Sri Lanka are eliminated from the World Cup despite the win. Because they can only tie England on 10 points - and England have more wins than SL. Number of wins is the first tie-breaker in the World Cup. NRR comes into play only after that. Those two abandoned games coming back to hurt SL.
7.08pm Avishka Fernando is the Player of the Match. Kumar Sangakkara his translator.

"When I went in, I was happy doing what was required from me, says Fernando. "They bowled well. Very happy this hundred came in a winning cause. Very happy that I got this opportunity. Happy to have made use of this opportunity. And all I want to focus on is improving my game for the country."

Usman Hickmath: "Does not matter not making to semis. No one expected them to get into top 4. Many said they will finish behind Afghanistan. But there is a good chance that they will finish on par with England interms of points. Avishka and Dimuth's captaincy are great finds. Positives to take. Well played guys "

RiwajAdhikari: "I have no regrets watching this rivetting nailbiter also reading the commentary here while my exams are in less than 10 days from today and still some lab assignments left to do. Long live cricket! "

VJ: "Shahzeb.....everyone questions the intent of Dhoni but none is praising how good english bowlers yesterday...there is always two sides for the coin...don't forget it. "
Sunil GK: "Real winner is young Pooran, winning millions of hearts! Love from IND "
Watch MATCH DAY right here - with Daniel Vettori, Ajit Agarkar, Daren Ganga and T Dilshan

Shahzeb: "though windies were in worst situation in last 10 overs then india but this is intent this is sportsmaship they are showing never die attitude this is how cricket wins shame on dhoni and other involved indian players"

Veer: "SL deserved to win this... middle order finally succeeded. Go down same path as SA, performing when there is no pressure."

7pm So Sri Lanka move to eight points - a deserved two points earned today. Sure, some may say West Indies deserved to win the match, but the comeback displayed by the SL bowlers deserves some rewards. Also, remember how solid Sri Lanka's batting was today. Karunaratne, the two Kusal's, Thirimanne and ofcourse, Avishka Fernando, batted beautifully to hand SL their highest score of WC 2019. As for West Indies, there were some sparks, especially when Pooran and Allen were batting, but eventually we were reminded once again how difficult it is to chase when there's a scoreboard pressure looming too.

dismissalText.commentary: Oshane Thomas lbw b Malinga 1 (6b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 16.66

commentTextItems.html: appeal for lbw but not given. Full, on leg stump, and the ball did hit his pad. Malinga reviews. Was there inside edge? Or did it land outside leg stump. Only one of those two things can save Oshane. Replays show that it lands on leg stump, takes no edge of the bat, and hits him on leg stump. What does ball tracking say? Crashing into leg stump! Umpire Oxenford has to reverse his decision...
low full toss, just outside off stump. He swings but misses

commentPreTextItems.html: Shankar: "Cheers to spirit of Cricket...Inspite of both the team out of Worldcup, we get to witness one of the great match"

commentTextItems.html: full outside off stump, and driven away from his body. Stopped by cover
length, on off, and defended back to the bowler. What an over!

commentPostTextItems.html: Zaheer : "@Waqar Durrani it was the beginning of the Sri Lankan rise. That match was the starting point. Lara made 169*, Sri Lanka lost the match, Pakistan disqualified for the final and Sri Lanka beat WI in the final to win the Singer Trophy in 1995"

commentTextItems.html: full outside off, and driven to cover. Thomas wants the single, and he would've been run-out had the fielder got a direct hit

commentPreTextItems.html: Nazim Ali: "This is cricket..... bowling for the first time in 18 months and he takes the wicket.....y didn't he do some push-ups now!!!!"

dismissalText.commentary: Nicholas Pooran c Perera b Mathews 118 (103b 11x4 4x6 156m) SR: 114.56

commentPreTextItems.html: Angelo Mathews will bowl an over! He last bowled in December 2017.

commentTextItems.html: Mathews strikes first ball! And what a fistpump to celebrate, very nearly knocked his team-mate out with that fist. Full ball outside off stump, angling away, and Pooran's attempted slog past cover takes a thin edge of his bat. Rousing applause for Pooran though

commentPostTextItems.html:
RiwajAdhikari: "Love you Mathews. Risking your hammy for your country. Hope you are okay."

Waqar Durrani: "In 5th Match, Singer Champions Trophy at Sharjah, Oct 16 1995, WI scored 333 batting first vs SL. It was like 434 of that time, but SL did manage to get 329/9 with 4 balls to spare before the centurion Hashan Tilkaratne got caught at boundary. Best chase of my childhood. Still WI vs SL, yet again."

commentTextItems.html: back of a length, on middle. He rides the bounce and gloves a shot to the leg side. Opportunity for a single, but they choose not to

Hetmyer dismissed Tickled it to short third and set off on a run without ever lifting his head up to see if his partner was following through. When he did he was more than halfway down, and a direct hit meant he wasn't even in the frame. West Indies are rocking now

dismissalText.commentary: Oshane Thomas lbw b Malinga 1 (6b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 16.66

dismissalComment.html: appeal for lbw but not given. Full, on leg stump, and the ball did hit his pad. Malinga reviews. Was there inside edge? Or did it land outside leg stump. Only one of those two things can save Oshane. Replays show that it lands on leg stump, takes no edge of the bat, and hits him on leg stump. What does ball tracking say? Crashing into leg stump! Umpire Oxenford has to reverse his decision...

seriesStandings.notes:
League Stage
In the event of teams finishing on equal points
* The team with the most wins in the League Stage will be placed in the higher position.
* If there are teams with equal points and equal wins in the League Stage then in such case the teams will be ordered according to their net run rate in the League Stage matches.
* If there are teams that are still equal, they will be ordered according to the result(s) of the head to head match(es) played between them (points, then if still equal, net run rate in those matches).
* If the above does not resolve the League Stage ordering and there are teams that are still equal, the teams will be ordered as per their League Stage seedings.
* If all matches in the League Stage produce no results the teams will be ordered as per their League Stage seedings and the top 4 seeded teams will progress to Semi-Finals.
Semi Final
If a Semi-Final is tied, the teams shall compete in a Super Over to determine which team progresses to the Final.
If following a tie, weather conditions prevent the Super Over from being completed, or if the match is abandoned or a no result at the end of the reserve day, then the team which proceeds to the Final will be the team that finished in the higher position in the League Stage.
Final
In the event of a tied final, the teams shall compete in a Super Over to determine which team is the winner.
If following a tie, weather conditions prevent the Super Over from being completed, or if the match is abandoned or a no result at the end of the reserve day, the teams shall be declared joint winners.
